gospel.text:
[[Mt 24,42]]Jesus said to his disciples: "Stay awake! For you do not know on which day your Lord will come.
[[Mt 24,43]]Be sure of this: if the master of the house had known the hour of night when the thief was coming, he would have stayed awake and not let his house be broken into.
[[Mt 24,44]]So too, you also must be prepared, for at an hour you do not expect, the Son of Man will come.
[[Mt 24,45]]Who, then, is the faithful and prudent servant, whom the master has put in charge of his household to distribute to them their food at the proper time?
[[Mt 24,46]]Blessed is that servant whom his master on his arrival finds doing so.
[[Mt 24,47]]Amen, I say to you, he will put him in charge of all his property.
[[Mt 24,48]]But if that wicked servant says to himself, 'My master is long delayed,'
[[Mt 24,49]]and begins to beat his fellow servants, and eat and drink with drunkards,
[[Mt 24,50]]the servant's master will come on an unexpected day and at an unknown hour
[[Mt 24,51]]and will punish him severely and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

first_reading.text:
[[1_Th 3,7]]We have been reassured about you, brothers and sisters, in our every distress and affliction, through your faith.
[[1_Th 3,8]]For we now live, if you stand firm in the Lord.
[[1_Th 3,9]]What thanksgiving, then, can we render to God for you, for all the joy we feel on your account before our God?
[[1_Th 3,10]]Night and day we pray beyond measure to see you in person and to remedy the deficiencies of your faith.
[[1_Th 3,11]]Now may God himself, our Father, and our Lord Jesus direct our way to you,
[[1_Th 3,12]]and may the Lord make you increase and abound in love for one another and for all, just as we have for you,
[[1_Th 3,13]]so as to strengthen your hearts, to be blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his holy ones. Amen.
first_reading.title: First Letter to the Thessalonians

psalm.text:
[[Ps 90,3]]You turn man back to dust, 
saying, "Return, O children of men."
[[Ps 90,4]]For a thousand years in your sight 
are as yesterday, now that it is past, 
or as a watch of the night.

[[Ps 90,12]]Teach us to number our days aright, 
that we may gain wisdom of heart.
[[Ps 90,13]]Return, O LORD! How long? 
Have pity on your servants!

[[Ps 90,14]]Fill us at daybreak with your kindness, 
that we may shout for joy and gladness all our days.
[[Ps 90,17]]And may the gracious care of the LORD our God be ours; 
Prosper the work of our hands for us! 
Prosper the work of our hands!
psalm.title: Psalms
